conclusion: Analyze the given acceleration-time graph to determine when the particle is farthest from the starting point.
Acceleration starts at 0, increases linearly to a0 at t0/2, decreases to 0 at t0, becomes negative to -a0 at 3t0/2, and returns to 0 at 2t0.
Velocity is the integral of acceleration; area under acceleration-time graph gives change in velocity.
Calculate velocity from 0 to t0/2: v(t0/2) = a0 t0/4.
Calculate velocity from t0/2 to t0: v(t0) = a0 t0/2.
Calculate velocity from t0 to 3t0/2: v(3t0/2) = a0 t0/4.
Position is the integral of velocity; area under velocity-time graph gives displacement.
Calculate position from 0 to t0/2: x(t0/2) = a0 t0^2/16.
Calculate position from t0/2 to t0: x(t0) = 3a0 t0^2/16.
